question.title: How to safely pass per report configuration between two separate JARs in INET (report engine)?
question.body:
I am working with an enterprise system (Multi instance system i.e each client have their own Database with their own URL) where reports are executed on a single JVM. The reports may run for several minutes, and multiple reports can overlap, each using a different database.

Here is the detailed situation: I have two separate JARs:

  • JAR A contains a method processData(String input) that needs some configuration value at runtime for transforming database field and is directly used in INET rpt files.
  • JAR B is responsible for preparing that configuration value before the report runs as this jar have the DB connection.

I cannot modify the reports themselves, cannot add parameters (as currently parameters are handled differently in code base), and cannot introduce new tables or views for reports.

Reports execute, and I donâ€™t have a clear hook for the start or end of the report execution. Multiple reports may execute concurrently, each using its own database.

My goal is to make the configuration value (The value come from DB) available to the method in JAR A during the report execution and ensure that:

  1. Each report uses its own database specific configuration.
  2. Reports do not interfere with each other if they run at the same time.
  3. No permanent global state is shared between reports.

I am aware of ThreadLocal , but I am unsure how the reporting engine handles threads internally. I do not know if it creates worker threads or reuses a pool, and the documentation is not clear on that.

Given this scenario, what are the safe approaches to make a per-report configuration available across two separate JARs? How can I ensure isolation between overlapping reports on different databases if I can not control the report lifecycle?

I need a solution that do not require modifying existing reports and can handle multiple overlapping reports on the same JVM.

For reference of INET: https://www.inetsoftware.de/en/i-net-clear-reports/
